hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric ETF Flow Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime (VIX < 20, BTC 20-day volatility < 50%), the first significant daily net inflow (>$200M) or outflow (>$150M) to US Spot Bitcoin ETFs after a 3-day period of sub-$50M net flows will trigger a disproportionate, multi-day price move that is 3-5x larger than the flow's implied instantaneous buying/selling pressure.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by low conviction and low liquidity provision. A large, discrete ETF flow acts as a high-signal catalyst that breaks the indecision. Market makers, anticipating follow-on flows and trend-follower reaction, re-price aggressively, creating momentum that far exceeds the simple dollar-for-dollar impact of the flow itself.
entry_conditions: 3 consecutive days of absolute net ETF flows < $50M
Day 4 ETF net flow magnitude exceeds threshold ($200M inflow or $150M outflow) as reported at ~9:30 AM ET
BTC 1-hour RSI(14) between 30 and 70 at 9:30 AM ET

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close position after 3 trading days (NYSE hours)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses to pre-catalyst-flow level (9:29 AM ET price) within the first 6 trading hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Large ETF flows in neutral regimes consistently result in price moves equal to or less than the flow's implied instantaneous impact (flow/$ daily volume), indicating no amplification from market structure or psychology.
